lead_paragraph: RAINONE--Nanette. BRIC mourns the loss of its founder Nanette Rainone, a trail-blazer who brought together artists, audiences, celebrities, donors and government officials to galvanize the Brooklyn community and spearhead community revitalization through the arts. Nanette led The Fund for the Borough of Brooklyn (later renamed BRIC) from 1979-2002. She launched ground-breaking programs and initiatives including the Celebrate Brooklyn! Performing Arts Festival, The Rotunda Gallery, the Welcome Back to Brooklyn Festival, Brooklyn Community Access Television, Art in the Anchorage (of the Brooklyn Bridge), the New York Beer Fest, and many other programs. She commissioned a study for adaptive reuse of the former Strand Theater on Fulton Street, which laid the groundwork for the development of BRIC House. Nanette was a great collaborator and led partnerships with BAM, the Brooklyn Museum, Brooklyn Public Library, Prospect Park, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, Brooklyn Historical Society, Arts at St Ann's, and many others. She was a force for good, and Brooklyn has benefitted greatly from her efforts. She will be missed, and was loved dearly by those who worked under her leadership. Hilary Ackermann, Board Chair Leslie Schultz, President Jack Walsh, Vice President 1/3
